newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish government to revise up 1997 GDP forecast.
newsitem.headline: Spanish government to revise up 1997 GDP forecast.

text.p: Spain's government will revise upward its 1997 gross domestic product (GDP) forecast, currently at three percent, Economy Secretary Cristobal Montoro said on Monday.
"The growth is very solid and it is not going to be a one-off event. It will last over time," Montoro told a seminar on the euro in Madrid.
He added that the new 1997 target will be a few decimal points above three percent but below 3.5 percent.
He also said that despite the economy's current growth at above three percent there was not a risk of it overheating.
Montoro reiterated that the government expected the economy to create around 350,000 new jobs this year.
